title: Reset World can mess up keyboard tele-op in local frame

content.raw:
The `HaptixGuiPlugin` uses the rotation component of `armStartPose` when [interpreting keyboard tele-op commands in the local frame](#!/osrf/handsim/src/1778f30a1a5357faab975f6035cf4d73bc88ab27/src/HaptixGUIPlugin.cc#cl-1231). This variable is reset in [OnResetClicked](#!/osrf/handsim/src/1778f30a1a5357faab975f6035cf4d73bc88ab27/src/HaptixGUIPlugin.cc#cl-990) and [OnResetSceneClicked](#!/osrf/handsim/src/1778f30a1a5357faab975f6035cf4d73bc88ab27/src/HaptixGUIPlugin.cc#cl-1003). If a user sets the `Reset World` action, however, then the `armStartPose` will not be reset, since `Reset World` does not trigger resets of GUI plugins (filed as [gazebo issue 1610](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/1610/propagate-reset-world-action-to-gui)).

Going in a different direction, can we use the current pose of the arm instead of storing our own copy of it in `armStartPose`?
content.html:
The HaptixGuiPlugin uses the rotation component of armStartPose when interpreting keyboard tele-op commands in the local frame. This variable is reset in OnResetClicked and OnResetSceneClicked. If a user sets the Reset World action, however, then the armStartPose will not be reset, since Reset World does not trigger resets of GUI plugins (filed as gazebo issue 1610).

Going in a different direction, can we use the current pose of the arm instead of storing our own copy of it in armStartPose?
